title: Pain is Infomation
content:
Pain is Infomation

As a child, you touched something hot, and it burned you. That pain gave you a piece of information: be careful touching hot things.

[小时候，你碰过一些热的东西，就会被烫伤。那种疼痛给了你一个信息：小心碰热的东西。]

When you sign up to run a marathon, you are signing up for pain. But whether or not you keep running is up to you. It’s been said that “pain is inevitable but suffering is optional”. You can choose pain without choosing suffering.

[当你报名参加马拉松比赛时，你就报名参加了痛苦。但是否继续跑步取决于你自己。有人说“痛苦是不可避免的，但苦难是可以选择的”。你可以选择痛苦而不选择苦难。]

Pain is information, and information is painful. Rewiring your brain is not a process. Some knowledge can only be discovered the hard way.

[痛苦就是信息，而信息就是痛苦。重新连接你的大脑并不是一个毫无摩擦的过程。有些知识只有通过艰难的方式才能发现。]

The sooner you can convert pain into knowledge, the sooner you can experience the next useful pain. Don’t put yourself through the same pain too many times. To access new information you must experience new pains.

[你越早将痛苦转化为知识，你就能越早体验下一个有用的痛苦。不要让自己多次经历同样的痛苦。为了获得新的信息，你必须经历新的痛苦。]

They say “knowledge is power”. If pain is information, then pain can be converted to power. To do so, you must learn to control your suffering, accept scars that are beautiful.

[他们说“知识就是力量”。如果痛苦是信息，那么痛苦就可以转化为力量。为此，你必须学会​​控制你的痛苦，接受伤疤是美丽的。]

If you felt pain, ask what information it gave you. If that information was useful, seek the next pain. You are learning.

[如果您感到疼痛，请询问它为您提供了哪些信息。如果该信息有用，请寻找下一个痛苦。你正在学习。]
